intro: Rytidosperma monticola, commonly known as the mountain spinifex, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spikelet-like inflorescences that are typically green or reddish in color. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, with deep root systems that help it survive in poor soils. Rytidosperma monticola plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native fauna.
